ygData.subject: RE: more sylly questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Yea I know all about chains overriding snare.  What I was asking about is the wording of the original message, which reads I did mention about snare breaks
ygData.messageBody:
Yea I know all about chains overriding snare. What I was asking about is
the wording of the original message, which reads "I did mention about snare
breaks root, but should have mentioned it can kill Darkness line DOTs". The
intent of my followup post was to clarify if the original poster meant to
type "chain breaks root" versus "snare breaks root".

Galtin of E'ci


> If a ranger or druid snares a mob and then you decide to chain it for
> whatever reason, the chain song being last in will strip or break or
> over-ride the snare. Same for root. The same goes for the darkness spell
> -
> but there my SK cousin yells at me because it canceled also the hp degrade
> effects too. Darkness degrades hp and slows target.
>
> Sylly
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, November 10, 1999 1:17 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] more sylly questions
>
>
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> Can you give more clarification on what you mean here? Did you intend to
> say
> Chain breaks root versus snare? Also, what do you mean by breaking
> darkness
> line DOTs. Never heard that one mentioned before.
>
> Thanks
> Galtin of E'ci
>
>
> > Some of this are what I would consider common game knowledge (ie invis
> > killing pets, Bellow breaking mesmerize since it is an attack). I did
> > mention the snare breaks root, but should have mentioned that it can
> kill
> > darkness line DoT's.
> >
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
> with
> the subject lol.
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
> with the subject lol.
